title: Red Alert: Critical flood situations in low-lying areas of 6 major rivers
byline: The Irrigation Department warned that that critical flood situations have already developed in the low-lying areas of the relevant river basins of six major rivers, and that water levels are expected to rise further.

title: Red Alert: Major flood situation in low-lying areas of Kelani River Basin
byline: The Irrigation Department warns that a major flood situation is likely to occur within the next 48 hours in the low-lying areas of the Kelani River valley.

title: Heavy showers and strong winds to continue due to Cyclone “Ditwah”
byline: The Cyclonic storm “Ditwah” is centered near latitude 7.7°N and longitude 81.5°E, about 20km Southwest of Batticaloa and it is very likely to move northnorthwestwards today (28), the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: All train services suspended due to bad weather
byline: The Railway Department has announced that train services on all routes have been suspended after 6:00 a.m. today (28), owing to the prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: Several BIA-bound flights diverted due to adverse weather
byline: At least three flights bound to Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) have been diverted to the prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: Level 3 landslide evacuation warning issued to 7 districts extended
byline: The ‘Level-3’ (Red) landslide evacuation warning issued for multiple areas in seven districts has been extended.

title: CSE to close early due to adverse weather
byline: Regular trading at the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) will be halted early today (28) due to the adverse weather prevailing across the country, the CSE announced.

title: Death toll due to adverse weather climbs to 56 with over 20 missing
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) reports that 46 deaths have been recorded within the past 72 hours as adverse weather conditions continue to affect the island.

title: Highest rainfall in past 24 hours recorded in Gammaduwa, Matale
byline: The highest rainfall within the last 24 hours has been reported from Gammaduwa in Matale, with rainfall levels recording 540 mm.

title: Heavy rainfall and gusty winds to continue across the island due to Cyclone ‘Ditwah’
byline: The Cyclonic Storm “Ditwah” is centered near latitude 8.1°N and longitude 81.2°E, about 50km South of Trincomalee and it is very likely to move north-northwestwards, the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Bus with around 70 passengers stuck on Kalawewa Bridge
byline: A bus carrying around 70 passengers has been stranded on the Kalawewa Bridge along the Anuradhapura–Puttalam road due to rising flood waters.

title: SJB’s Ismail Muththu Mohamed resigns as MP
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Parliamentarian Ismail Muththu Mohamed has announced his resignation from his position as a Member of Parliament.

title: Colombo-Kandy main road closed in Kegalle due to landslide risk
byline: A section of the Colombo-Kandy main road has been closed between the 88 km and 89 km mile posts in Meepitiya, Kegalle, due to the risk of landslides.

title: Six Sri Lanka-bound flights diverted due to adverse weather
byline: Due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions in Sri Lanka, six flights bound to the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) have been diverted to Mattala, Trivandrum, and Cochin airports, BIA officials said. ,

title: SriLankan Airlines advises passengers to check flight status before arriving at airport
byline: SriLankan Airlines has announced the passengers to check the latest flight status before arriving at the airport, as adverse weather conditions continue to affect the island.

title: Leave of all police personnel cancelled due to bad weather
byline: Police Headquarters has announced that all leave and days off for police officers have been cancelled due to the adverse weather conditions affecting the island.

title: Red Alert: Heavy showers and strong winds to continue amid Cyclone ‘Ditwah’
byline: The Meteorology Department has issued a ‘Red’ alert warning for the land and the sea areas around the island due to the Cyclonic Storm “Ditwah.”

title: Several roads in Colombo blocked due to adverse weather – Police
byline: Several areas in Colombo have also been affected by the adverse weather conditions, police stated.

title: Irrigation Dept. warns of major flood risk in Kalu Ganga basin
byline: The heavy rainfall currently affecting the Kalu Ganga basin, along with data analysis conducted by the Irrigation Department, indicates that a major flood situation is likely to occur within the next few hours.

title: Bus stranded on Kalawewa Bridge: Water rises to waist level of passengers
byline: A bus carrying around 70 passengers, which became stranded on the Kalawewa Bridge along the Anuradhapura–Puttalam road, is reportedly facing rising floodwaters, reaching the waist level of passengers onboard.

title: Minor flood situation reported in Matara District
byline: The Matara Disaster Management Unit reports that a minor flood situation has been experienced in the Matara district.

title: NTC issues special advisory for public transport employees
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) has issued a special advisory to bus employees providing public transport services, due to the adverse weather conditions affecting the island.

title: Landslide strikes house in Nawalapitiya, killing three including an infant
byline: Three members of the same family were killed when a landslide struck a residence on Old Railway Yard Road in Nawalapitiya today (28).

title: Sri Lankan tri-forces mobilized for rescue operations across Sri Lanka
byline: The President has instructed the Army Commander to deploy Sri Lanka Army  (SLA) troops for the rescue and assistance of citizens affected by the prevailing adverse weather conditions across the island.

title: Kaduwela exit of Southern Expressway flooded; Motorists advised to use alternative routes
byline: The Kaduwela exit of the Southern Expressway has been reportedly inundated, causing disruption to motorists travelling from the Kadawatha direction.

title: Kaduwela interchange of expressway closed due to flooding
byline: Vehicular traffic at the Kaduwela Expressway Interchange has been completely halted due to the overflowing of the Kelani River caused by the prevailing heavy rainfall.

title: Colombo could experience worst floods in decades tomorrow night - officials warn
byline: The Secretary of the Ministry of Defence, Air Vice Marshal Sampath Thuyacontha (Retd), stated that the police and tri-forces are actively reaching affected areas to rescue people impacted by the prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: 13 persons trapped on Manampitiya Bridge rescued by SLAF helicopter
byline: Thirteen individuals who were stranded on the Manampitiya Bridge in Polonnaruwa have been safely rescued by a SLAF Bell-212 helicopter.

title: Police release 47 emergency hotlines for reporting disaster situations
byline: Due to the ongoing adverse weather conditions across the island, the Sri Lanka Police has introduced dedicated telephone numbers to provide information and assistance to the public regarding disaster situations.

title: President directs officials to prioritize relief operations without financial constraints
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has instructed District Secretaries to proceed with rescue and relief operations for affected communities without allowing financial constraints to hinder their work, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Five dead, 12 missing after earth slip in Minipe
byline: Five people have been confirmed dead and 12 others have been reported missing following an earth slip in the Pamunupura area of Minipe, Hasalaka, the Kandy District Secretary announced.

title: Police introduce emergency hotline for life-saving assistance
byline: Sri Lanka Police has introduced an emergency contact number for the public to seek assistance for life-saving operations.

title: India’s INS Vikrant to deploy helicopters for flood relief efforts in Sri Lanka
byline: India has expressed its willingness to provide helicopters for rescue operations to assist people affected by the ongoing disaster situation in Sri Lanka.

title: Modi expresses condolences for victims; announces immediate help to Sri Lanka
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has expressed his condolences to the people of Sri Lanka affected by Cyclone ‘Ditwah’, noting the loss of lives and the hardships faced across the country.

title: Manusath Derana flood relief programme now underway
byline: The Manusath Derana “Flood Relief” programme is currently underway.

title: President urged to declare state of emergency amid disaster situation
byline: Leaders of opposition parties have submitted a proposal to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake urging the implementation of a state of emergency in the country, specifically to manage the ongoing disaster situation.

title: High-risk flood warning issued for low-lying areas of Kelani River basin
byline: The Department of Irrigation has issued a red alert for the low-lying areas of the Kelani River Basin, warning of a high risk of flooding at a level unprecedented in recent history.

title: Multiple flights to BIA cancelled or diverted due to bad weather
byline: Several flights scheduled to arrive at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake, have been cancelled due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: Residents of Dompe, Biyagama, and Kelaniya’s low-lying areas urged to evacuate
byline: Gampaha District Secretary Lalinda Gamage has urged residents of low-lying areas in Dompe, Biyagama, and Kelaniya to evacuate immediately due to the rapidly worsening flood situation.

title: Landslide risk forces partial closure of expressway section
byline: A lane on the Gelanigama-Kahathuduwa Expressway has been temporarily closed for vehicles due to a potential landslide risk as a result of the prevailing heavy rainfall and adverse weather conditions.

title: Sri Lankan cricketers to donate Pakistan tour earnings to help flood victims
byline: The Sri Lankan cricket team, which is currently participating in a tri-series tournament in Pakistan, has decided to donate tour money and match fees from the series to support those affected floods and landslides in Sri Lanka.

title: Major flood warning for Gampaha town and surrounding areas
byline: The Irrigation Department has warned that the low-lying areas of the Attanagalu Oya and Uruwal Oya valleys, including parts of Gampaha town, may experience a major flood situation within the next six hours.

title: Several services including electricity, fuel supply declared essential services
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has issued an extraordinary gazette notification declaring a number of services, including the supply of electricity, as essential services.

title: NBRO sounds warning regarding landslide-prone areas
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has warned that landslides could occur at any moment in any mountainous region due to the prevailing severe weather conditions.

title: 2025 GCE A/L exam postponed until further notice
byline: The Commissioner General of Examinations has announced that the 2025 G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) Examination has been postponed until further notice due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions across the country.

title: PM Harini briefs diplomatic community on flood relief and recovery efforts
byline: Sri Lanka Tourism has designated a responsible officer to handle inquiries regarding foreign tourists affected by the current disaster situation.

title: India navy ships hand over relief material in Colombo
byline: On behalf of the Government of India, the Indian navy ships INS Vikrant and INS Udaygiri, which are on a visit to Sri Lanka, have officially handed over flood relief material the island nation in Colombo.

title: Limited train services to operate only in Western Province today
byline: Several train services have been resumed this evening (28) only within the Western Province, according to railway authorities.

title: Schools to reopen on December 16
byline: Schools will reopen for the final phase of the third school term on December 16, according to the Secretary to the Ministry of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Education, Nalaka Kaluwewe.

title: Death toll climbs to 69 after landslides and severe floods in Sri Lanka
byline: Sri Lankan troops were racing to rescue hundreds of people marooned by rising floodwaters on Friday as weather-related deaths rose to 69, with another 34 people declared missing.

title: Russia threatens full ban on WhatsApp
byline: Russia’s state communications watchdog threatened on Friday to block WhatsApp entirely if it fails to comply with Russian law, news agencies reported.
